weather_report:
As the morning sun peeks from behind a curtain of light cloud cover, it casts a muted glow over Downtown San Francisco, hinting at the promise of a pleasant day. The air feels fresh, though a slight chill lingers, whispering of the ocean's proximity. The vividness of the city is somewhat subdued, with only a hint of the golden hues shimmering through the marine layer, suggestive of a playful dance between sun and fog. With a gentle breeze weaving through the streets from the west, the temperature hovers comfortably around 63 degrees, yet those venturing out should be prepared for a slight drop as the afternoon progresses.

As the hours unfold, a slight chance of drizzle remains, fading in the early evening, likely leaving behind only traces on the pavement. Clouds will blanket the sky tonight, possibly wrapping the city in a soft, gray embrace as the temperature dips into the mid-50s. Dress in layers—perhaps a light sweater or a knit scarf—to savor the cool serenity of this San Francisco summer day while setting off for a leisurely walk along the Embarcadero or finding solace in a cozy café where the smell of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the lingering scent of the bay. Each choice feels like a gentle nod to the city’s rhythms, allowing one to savor its understated charms even on days when the fog plays coy.
